title: Calories in Benihana Meals
meta_description: Discover calories in Benihana hibachi entrees, including steak, chicken, and shrimp options, with full nutrition breakdowns and serving tips for your next visit.
assumptions: Standard hibachi steak entree (~8 oz steak, 1 cup fried rice, grilled vegetables, miso soup, and 2-piece shrimp appetizer); cooked in hibachi style with minimal added oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, portion size, customizations, and preparation; Benihana values may differâ€”check their menu or app for exact info.

quick_answer.text: A typical Benihana hibachi steak meal has about 850 kcal, with high protein from steak and carbs from rice.

label_note: Values mirror standard Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with restaurant disclosures.

tweaks.label: Add Benihana house salad with ginger dressing
Choose shrimp entree instead of steak

faqs.q: How many calories in a Benihana hibachi steak?
faqs.a: About 850 kcal for a standard serving with rice and veggies.

faqs.q: What are the macros for calories in Benihana meals?
faqs.a: Typically 48 g protein, 42 g fat, 65 g carbs per hibachi steak serving.

faqs.q: Are Benihana meals high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1400 mg per serving due to soy sauce and seasonings.

faqs.q: Calories in Benihana fried rice alone?
faqs.a: About 300-400 kcal per cup, depending on added proteins.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in Benihana orders?
faqs.a: Opt for grilled items without appetizers, skip rice, or choose veggie-focused entrees.
